DataElement.preferredName: Neuroblastoma Disease or Disorder Soft Tissue Involvement Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the type of soft tissue involvement associated with neuroblastoma.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Neuroblastoma Disease or Disorder Soft Tissue Involvement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to neuroblastoma (a neuroblastic tumor characterized by the presence of neuroblastic cells) and soft tissue (muscle, fat, fibrous tissue, blood vessels, or other supporting tissues of the body) involvement (sharing in an activity or process).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Neuroblastoma is a specific type of neuroblastic tumor which is characterized by the presense of neuroblastic cells forming groups or nests separated by delicate stromal septa without prominent Schwannian stroma. (Adapted from WHO.):Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: A malignant neuroblastic tumor characterized by the presence of neuroblastic cells, the absence of ganglion cells, and the absence of a prominent Schwannian stroma formation.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Refers to muscle, fat, fibrous tissue, blood vessels, or other supporting tissue of the body.:To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: A general term comprising tissue that is not hardened or calcified; including muscle, fat, blood vessels, nerves, tendons, ligaments and fascia.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.
